channel.title: kaidez - Web Development Tutorials & JavaScript Coding Tips
channel.description: Expert web development tutorials, JavaScript tips, and coding best practices. Learn modern web development with React, Node.js, TypeScript, and more from an experienced developer.

item.title: TUTORIAL: A Simple jQuery Image Fade In/Fade Out With A Delay
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: An easy jQuery tutorial to fade in and fade out two images with a delay

item.title: TUTORIAL: A Simple, Effective jQuery Image Rollover
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: A very popular, cross-browser complaint jQuery image rollover

item.title: Welcome Back!!!!!!!!
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: kaidez.com is no longer a blog that focuses on soccer/footie...it now focuses on web development.

item.title: TUTORIAL: Create The Building Blocks For An HTML5 Page
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Understanding the HTML5 DTD and Character Set Needed For Your First HTML5 Page.

item.title: REVIEW: lynda.com
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: A mostly positive review of lynda.com and its courses, front-end development and PhotoShop are discussed.

item.title: The Two Best Books On The Dot-com Rush
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Michael Lewis and Joseph Menn wrote two great books on the Dot-com Rush.

item.description: Great HTML5 learning resources

item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: kaidez's view of Flash's evolution, rise and (somewhat) fall.

item.title: My HTML5 Applications
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: I'm starting to narrow down what my favorite HTML5 tools are.

item.title: I'm Focusing On .NET C#
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: kaidez lays out a plan on how he'll learn .NET/C#.

item.title: CNN calls the do not track option a 'Google killer'
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Quick recap of CNN's article on the FTC's proposal of adding a do not track feature that consumers can use for internet browsing, short opinion included

item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: HTML5 Gallery, mostly maintained by the HTML5 expert over at HTML5 Doctor, is added to kaidez.com's Coolsite list

item.title: 10 WordPress Tips For Web Designers
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: 10 great tips that can help you with WordPress development, customization and security.

item.title: 5 Reasons To Design Websites For Internet Explorer 6

item.description: HTML5 Gallery, mostly maintained by the HTML5 expert over at HTML5 Doctor, is added to kaidez.com's Coolsite list

item.description: A review of the Pro HTML5 Programming by Apress

item.title: jQuery T-shirt - Geek Gift To Myself
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: My cool jQuery t-shirt

item.title: TUTORIAL: How AJAX, jQuery and HTML5 Work Together
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: AJAX, jQuery and HTML5 are big buzz words in the web design/development community nowadays. While getting these web technologies to work together is exciting, the programming required to do this isn't new.

item.title: New Almay Project I Worked On
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Kaidez developed four micro-sites for Almay using HTML5 video, jQuery, .NET and CSS

item.title: Read My Article At Inspired Magazine!!!

item.description: Kaidez guest post at Inspired Magazine responded to Cameron Chapman's web designer article at Smashing Magazine

item.title: 10 Things To Remember About HTML5 Video
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: HTML5 Video Tips from kaidez

item.title: HTML5 Project Update: 1/21/11
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: My HTML5 Project will use HTML5, CSS3, jQuery, Modernizr, maybe CSS PIE, and will be a portfolio of my work and experiments.

item.title: Great Video Lecture on WordPress Usability & Analytics
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Stefanos Kofopoulos from pestaola.gr shares some excellent usability & analytics tips that he applied to his Wordpress-based blog.

item.title: My Study Schedule As Of January 26, 2011
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: How I plan to study HTML5, CSS3 and .NET

item.title: HTML5, SEO and Microdata
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: HTML5's Microdata feature is a good tactic if properly formatted

item.description: Additions to my list of resources to help you learn web design and development and my Coolsites list, including a Sitecore and .NET development blog

item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Using WebMatrix to create a WordPress development site

item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Part Two of my explanation on how I created wireframed my HTML5 site before I developed and designed it

item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Final article in the HTML5 wireframe series for the kaidez portfolio site

item.description: The social listening panel at NYC Social Media Week showed how companies like Pepsi track their products within the social networks

item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: The cross mobile promotion panel at NY Social Media Week used Nielsen and comScore stats to show how brands use mobile to promote products

item.title: Two JavaScript Tasks That jQuery Does Not Replace
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Short article about how jQuery does not have a replacement for JavaScript's document.write and has a not-so-great replacement for its navigator.UserAgent

item.title: Social Media Week Follow-Up & A Word From Panelist Kristin Volk
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Kristin Volk of MediaVest added some extra information to my recap of the Cross-Mobile Promotion panel at the 2011 NYC Social Media Week

item.title: Update to My HTML5/SEO/Microdata Post
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Oli Studholme from HTML5 Doctor corrects my previous post on HTML5, SEO and microdata

item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: A list of great HTML5 articles compiled by kaidez

item.title: HTML5 Readiness - NEW COOLSITE!
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: HTML5 Readiness neatly displays browser support for HTML5 and CSS3

item.title: The HTML5 Boilerplate Video is AWESOME!!!!!!
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Paul Irish's HTML5 Boilerplate video is extremely informative as it demonstrates many great CSS and JavaScript hacks and best practices

item.title: I'm Going To MIX11/Las Vegas!
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Kai Gittens, (kaidez) will be at Microsoft's Mix11 Conference in Las Vegas in April 2011 and will be at the HTML5/CSS3 and jQuery bootcamps

item.title: Yoast's Awesome WordPress SEO Speech
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: A quick review of a great WordPress SEO speech from Joost de Valk, AKA Yoast, with the video embedded on the page for instant viewing

item.title: HTML5 Project: Boilerplate WordPress Theme
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Walk-through of Aaron T. Grogg's excellent HTML5 Boilerplate-based WordPress theme. Includes a great admin screen for custom configuration.

item.title: 10 Tips For High Schoolers Wanting To Be Web Designers Or Developers
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: An extensive article with tips, resources and ideas for high school students wanting to work in the web design or development field someday

item.title: Easy-To-Read Version of The HTML5 Specification
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Ben Schwarz gives us HTML5-A technical specification for Web developers, translating WHATWG's HTML5 arduous spec into layman's terms

item.title: REVIEW: jQuery: Visual Quickstart Guide
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: A negative review of Peachpit Press' jQuery: Visual Quickstart Guide, but it doesn't take away from the fact that the VQS Series is great

item.title: HTML5 Project Update: Changing To A Responsive Web Design Using CSS3 Media Queries
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: An article on responsive web design, CSS3 media queries and using it in kaidez's HTML5 Project, resource list of links at the end

item.title: TUTORIAL: Creating A Rounded Corner, Transparent CSS3 Link For IE 6 Through 8 With CSS3 Pie
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: A tutorial on creating a rounded corner, transparent CSS3 link in Internet Explorer 6 through 8 with CSS3 PIE

item.title: HTML5 Boilerplate Goes To Version 1.0
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: A quick review of HTML5 Boilerplate version 1.0, discussing the new build script for site optimization and custom site template build

item.title: New York Times Article On HTML5: Their New HTML5 Site
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: A great New York Times piece on HTML5 application development and a demo of their new HTML5 Skimmer site

item.title: Off I Go To MIX11/Las Vegas!
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: A list of front-end web development courses that kaidez will take at MIX11 2011 and brief explanations of some other courses available

item.title: My 50th Article - A Retrospective!
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: kaidez reviews his progress with learning web development and how his blog is doing in terms of content, SEO and social network promotion

item.title: New Mitchum Project I Worked On
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: The new Mitchum site was developed with HTML5 using HTML5 Boilerplate, Visual Studio 2010 with NuGet, CSS and some light jQuery

item.title: New Almay Facebook Page I Worked On
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: kaidez developed Almay's Facebook What's New page following some best practices in terms of mobile web development.

item.title: Mobile Web Development Best Practices - Starting Tips
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Starter mobile web development best practices including YSlow & Page Speed tests and minifying pages with HTML5 Boilerplate's build script

item.title: 2 Bad Things About the Facebook App Setup
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Creating a Facebook app is easy but doing so generates CSS expressions and creates page reflows, all of which reduce page optimization

item.title: 5 Mobile Web Development Best Practice Resources
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Great mobile web development best practice resource list-includes site speed gurus, blogs & a podcast featuring jQuery creator, John Resig.

item.title: Remembering Steve Jobs
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: kaidez recalls the best about Steve Jobs

item.title: REVIEW: HTML5 Games Development by Example: Beginner’s Guide
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Great book for learning HTML5 games development as well as web development best practices. Discusses offline storage, Canvas, node.js & more!

item.title: SCREENCAST TUTORIAL: JavaScript for() loop That Creates A jQuery Fade In/Fade Out
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: JavaScript for loop dynamically creates a jQuery fade in/fade out effect with a delay; includes a demo, code sample and screencast tutorial.

item.title: A Simple Explanation of HTML5
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: A lengthy but simple explanation of what HTML5 is with suggestions on how business can use it. Very little technical language is used.

item.title: TUTORIAL: What NYC Subways Can Teach Us About JavaScript Closures
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: JavaScript closures tutorial using the New York City subway to explain how they work. With demo, code samples and short reading list.

item.title: Best JavaScript Learning Resources for Developers (2025) - 4 Books + 1 Podcast
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Great, useful JavaScript books listed from easiest to hardest. Authors include John Resig, Douglas Crockford and Stoyan Stefanov.

item.title: 5 Reasons Why You Need To Learn To Use JavaScript Before jQuery
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: A list of good reasons why it's better to learn JavaScript before jQuery. A short learning resource list at the end to help you get started.

item.title: The kaidez JavaScript Conference Tour: Leg 1: Fluent 2012/San Francisco
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: kaidez discusses what courses and sessions he'll be checking out at the 2012 Fluent JavaScript Conference. Node, and Jasmine are a few of them.

item.title: SCREENCAST TUTORIAL: Using JavaScript Off-DOM
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: How to create/change page elements off-DOM with JavaScript. Discusses createDocumentFragment, cloneNode, appendChild, jQuery .attr() & more.

item.title: REVIEW: Eloquent JavaScript
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Great JavaScript book for beginners covering the fundamentals in detail, focusing on how to use them in web applications, not just websites.

item.title: TUTORIAL: Remove Files From GitHub
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Get quick answers first, then learn how Git works with GitHub. This post also has an excellent list of Git/GitHub learning links at the end.

item.title: Media Queries Are Important
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: CSS3 media queries can help sites perform better in Google search results and the W3C officially recommends them as a web standard.

item.title: Where I've Been...Upcoming Site Update
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: A quick update about the status of kaidez.com, including the announcing of a new, upcoming site design.

item.title: kaidez 2013 Site Redesign
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: kaidez.com uses Jekyll as a blog engine, Grunt as a task runner, RequireJS for modular JavaScript management, & Bower for package management

item.title: GitHub Tutorial Update
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: kaidez's Git/GitHub tutorial is updated to be shorter, provide information faster and by providing 2 new links to the learning resource list

item.title: Using RequireJS In WordPress
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Learn how to use RequireJS in WordPress. Includes a walk-through of how RequireJS works and how WordPress manages JavaScript internally.

item.title: TUTORIAL: Jekyll Search with Non-JavaScript/CSS Fallback
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: jQuery-powered search functionality for a Jekyll site with fallback code if JS or CSS is disabled. Look at the demo before using the code.

item.title: REVIEW: Downloaded
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: The Napster documentary recaps the company’s story and the atmosphere it created, but it doesn't tell the whole story.

item.title: Web Components Demo: Templates and (some) Shadow DOM
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: A Web Components demo using just templates and Shadow DOM, mostly templates. Post includes many links to Web Component learning resources.

item.title: Site I Worked On: RevlonProBrands.com
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: kaidez developed the RevlonProBrands.com site using GitHub Atom, Jade, OOCSS, Modernizr’s yepnope functionality, Gulp & Grunt.

item.title: kaidez courses on lynda.com (now LinkedIn Learning)
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: kaidez recorded Ember.js and Backbone.js courses for lynda.com, a leading online learning company.

item.title: TUTORIAL: Load data attributes with Mouse Clicks
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Use mouse clicks to load information stored in data attributes onto a web page in a cross-browser compatible way. Contains lots of demos.

item.title: REVIEW: Effective JavaScript
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Excellent book that explains complicated JavaScript concepts like API design in painstaking clarity. Great for intermediate JS developers.

item.title: TUTORIAL: Filter Content With jQuery.filter() & jQuery Selectors
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Use jQuery.filter() & Attribute Selectors with HTML5 data attributes to filter out specific content on a click. Includes a code demo.

item.title: AJAX Tutorial Update
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: kaidez's old AJAX tutorial was updated. jQuery AJAX is discussed in depth and there's a short discussion on JavaScript Promises.

item.title: kdz - My Personal Scaffolding Tool
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: kaidez used Node to create a tool for scaffolding out web development projects. Includes a link to thoroughly commented code on GitHub.

item.title: Site I Worked On: parlorhairstudio.com
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: kaidez created a WordPress site for a Montclair, NJ hair salon, with a strong focus on optimizing the site for local SEO.

item.title: SCREENCAST: CSS Build Demo
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: A demo of how to optimize CSS with Gulp, Grunt and tasks like uncss and critical path css. Has a link to fully-commented code on GitHub.

item.title: Goodbye, Revlon
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: After almost ten years, I'm leaving Revlon to pursue a exciting new opportunity.

item.title: Write Code Every F–king Day!
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: The best way to learn web development is to try and write at least one piece of code a day, especially if the code is JavaScript.

item.title: Click to Tweet Link Created Dynamically With JS
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Tutorial for dynamically creating a click to Tweet link with JavaScript and the window.location object…no hard-coding. With demos and code samples.

item.title: kaidez 2015 site redesign
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: kaidez.com uses underscores to create a custom Swiss-style Wordpress theme for his blog's new design. webpack and gulp manage the JS/CSS build process.

item.title: Babel Setup For Beginners
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: How I set up Babel, Browserify, Babelify & Babel ES2015 presets for web development. Great for Babel beginners. Contains lots of resource links.

item.title: SCREENCAST: Build Tasks With npm run
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Watch how I use npm run to run HTML, CSS and JavaScript build tasks. An alternative to using Grunt, Gulp and similar tools.

item.title: The Head First Duck Simulator In Typescript
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: TypeScript recreates the Duck Simulator/Strategy pattern described in the 'Head First Design Patterns' book. With lots of resource links.

item.title: jQuery: It's OK To Use It
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: jQuery allows for too much productivity for web developers to stop using it completely. But they should understand when to use it, and why.

item.title: 10 Tips for High School Students Wanting to be Web Designers/Developers-2016 edition
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Tips for high schoolers wanting to be web designers/developers while looking at the state of technology education and hiring in 2016.

item.title: Click To Tweet Tutorial Update
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: kaidez’s click to Tweet tutorial is updated to be shorter, more readable, provide information faster & demonstrate some window.location JavaScript tricks.

item.title: What I Learned About Finding A Front End Web Developer Job In 2017-UPDATED
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Random notes on my past & present experiences in looking for a front end web developer job in 2017. Has tips for code bootcamp graduates looking for work.

item.title: Want to Learn Javascript Unit Testing? Learn Functional Programming First!
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Learn JavaScript unit testing by creating smaller functions with functional programming & testing them with QUnit. Lots of learning resources links.

item.title: Format Dates with Functional Programming
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Use JavaScript functional programming to format dates with the Date() object. Includes a React example.

item.title: Setup Link Functionality with Functional Programming
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Use JavaScript functional programming to set click-to-link functionality on a set of elements. Code sample has a basic webpack/Babel setup.

item.title: The State of JavaScript
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: React/Redux are part of JavaScript's progression to a full application language. Study this progression to prepare yourself for the future.

item.title: kaidez 2017 site redesign
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Kai takes a simplistic approach to updating his blog, using Jekyll, GitHub Pages, BEM CSS, a little bit of React, webpack and Yarn.

item.title: Display Temperature Averages with JavaScript Functional Programming
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Use JavaScript functional programming to display average temperatures in certain cities. Uses the .map() & .reduce() methods. Includes demo.

item.title: My 101st Post – A Retrospective!
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: kaidez publishes his 101st post and uses it to reflect on what he's learned as a web developer.

item.title: Use .filter() Instead of an Inner Loop in My JS Average Temperature Code
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: kaidez updates his JavaScript functional programming/average temperature post to use .filter() instead of an inner loop. Includes demo.

item.title: JavaScript Developers...Stop HATING Frameworks!!!
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: JavaScript developers can avoid using frameworks and libraries if the have to, but too many developers avoid them for the wrong reasons.

item.title: What I Learned About Finding A Front End Web Developer Job In 2022
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Six things I learned when looking for a front end web developer job in 2022. Also lists the top FE web dev skills employers are looking for.

item.title: Search Autocomplete Thing I Did
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Quick thoughts on building a small search autocomplete tool. What I learned, what I liked and what I didn't like.

item.title: How AI is Changing Entry-Level Tech Jobs (And What New Developers Can Do)
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: A Stanford study shows is AI hurting entry-level tech jobs. Young developers need experience to compete in 2025 job market.

item.title: Kaidez 2025 Site Redesign
item.dc:creator: Kai Gittens
item.description: Redesigned kaidez.com after 8 years using Eleventy, Claude AI & Cline. Supreme-inspired design + llms.txt implementation.
